title: Is it always daytime in exactly half of the world and nighttime in the other half? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. The Sun is significantly larger than the Earth. Its light will reach beyond 180 degrees because of the angle of the light rays from the Sun’s area beyond the Earth’s circumference. The atmosphere on Earth will also refract these rays and show them after sunset. The periods of light in this extended time are referred to as twilight. There are three periods of twilight—Civil Twilight (the brightest period), Nautical Twilight, and Astronomical Twilight. In the morning these periods comprise Dawn, and in the evening they are Dusk. After the Astronomical Dusk it is dark; night. The dark remains until the Astronomical Dawn. You can find more details at - Twilight, Dawn, and Dusk
